intro: Bosistoa brassii, commonly known as the African sandthorn, is a small, dioecious shrub native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and distinctive, thorn-like stems. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing resilience to drought conditions. Bosistoa brassii plays a role in local ecosystems and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
